Dating: AMENHOTEP IV/AMENOPHIS IV/NEFERKHEPERURE/AKHENATEN (not after); AMENHOTEP III/AMENOPHIS III/NEBMAATRE (not before)
Technique: TECHNIQUE OF CERAMICS; FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; BURNED
Name: Bes vase
Description: The upper part of the vessel is shaped like the face mask of the god Bes. The details of his jester's physiognomy have been largely added in paint. The funnel-shaped neck with a frieze of leaves adorns the head of this popular deity, rendering his usual feather crown.
